decision_conditions: <p>The use of the approved basement must be utilised as non-residential habitable rooms unless agreed otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To ensure a high quality of accommodation.</p>

<p>No development shall commence, other than works of demolition, until a report (including intrusive investigation/trial pit and monitoring where necessary)
demonstrating that the basement development will not increase the potential for groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area has been submitted
to the Local Planning Authority for approval. Details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance measures against surface water
(overland flow) and groundwater (if identified) shall be submitted to the LPA for approval and the approved measures incorporated before the basement is
occupied. The basement shall be constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for
"protection of below ground structures against water from the ground" and current best practice.</p><p>REASON: To mitigate against the effects of groundwater flooding and to comply with Policy LP53 of the Local Plan.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
description: Excavation to create basement extension; installation of one front and one rear lightwell
